course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Structural Analysis
course.description: Structural forms and modeling, statically determinate structures, statically indeterminate structures, force and displacement methods, deflections of structures, influence lines, approximate analysis, energy methods.
course.prerequisites: CIVL 2110 AND CIVL 2120

reviews.author: mhcm138
reviews.title: Harsh Grade Distribution
reviews.comment_content:
‚úíÔ∏èThe scope of the course is:

1.Equivalent System
2.Static Determinacy
3.Stability
4.Internal Forces
5.[N],[V],[M] Digrams
6.Short Review on Trusses
7.Influence Lines
8.Conjugate Beam Method
9.Energy Method
10.Virtual Work
11.Force Method
12.Slope-Deflection Method
13.Moment-Distribution Method

In this semester, midterm (=online final exam) covered 7-11. The final Project included 11-13
reviews.comment_teaching:
‚úÖ He was willing to answer student's questions in details after the lectures. TA always attended lectures, so they were quite helpful addressing your enquiries regarding the course content.

‚úÖ Lambros may adopt the short-cut method in solving problems which were quite different from the traditional textbook method. For example, he used kinematic consideration (stability analysis) to perform influence line calculations.

‚úÖ Due to the social situation, Lambros uploaded lecture videos for the very last parts of the course, which was a great arrangement and beneficial to our revision. FYI, Lambros never recorded lecture videos in any circumstances in the past years.

‚ùå His lecture materials were quite spontaneous as he may ask the class to pick the numbers for his example randomly. Make sure you sit at the first few rows because he did not provide lecture notes. He wrote all the contents on the whiteboard. Therefore you need to copy them. Sometimes his drawings were quite messy, and students were unable to see the numbers and details. So it would be a disadvantage sitting at the very back. Moreover, it is notable to note that Lambros demonstrate the questions at a quick pace. A mediocre student like me always found the lectures hard to follow.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lambros adopted a harsh grade distribution. The midterm in November was suspended due to sudden events during congregation ceremony. Consequently, the final online exam replaced the midterm.

üíØCourse Grading:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Homework and Quizzes - 30%
2Ô∏è‚É£ Final online exam on 17/12 (non-proctored) - 35%
3Ô∏è‚É£ Final Project (given a few weeks to complete) - 35%

‚ùó Zero transparency in grading unless you approach TA to enquire your score. Professor said the marks of all the students are much higher than usual so A- cut off was 92%. üò±üò±üò±üò±
reviews.comment_workload: Structural engineering courses usually have a higher workload. For CIVL3310, the primary workload is to attend all the lectures and copy all the notes from the whiteboard. Otherwise, you cannot revise for the exam. It is compulsory to attend all the lectures because there were quizzes to be completed, which counted towards your final grade. You will never know when Lambros will assign the quizzes. For off-class workload, you may need to spend substantial time to understand the concepts and examples completely. To achieve better performance, you may need to do the tutorial examples, lecture examples, past papers by hand.

reviews.author: UncleT
reviews.title: The reason of Lambros' baldness is knownüôÉ
reviews.comment_content:
[Before talking about the actual content, I MUST point out that CIVL 2110&2120 are the CORNERSTONEs of this course. Topics like truss, centroid, BMD in 2110 and deflection (method of direct integration) in 2120 will be covered again. If you forget these concepts, please brush them up so you can learn more comfortably and suffer less.]

Topics [relationship and duration]:
Stability [extended from Statics, more comprehensive; L1-L7]
Influence lines [COR in Stability is extensively used; L8-L11]
Review on 2110&2120 [L12-L13]
Conjugate beam [L14]
Energy method [L15-L16]
Virtual work [extended from Energy method, more convenient; L17-L18]

‚ö†Ô∏è Starting from here, you need to deal with statically INDETERMINATE problems, which are more troublesome!
Force method [basically application of Virtual work; L18-L20]
Displacement method [aka Slope-deflection method; L20-L22]
Moment distribution method [variation of Displacement method; L23]

üí¢ As topics are correlated to each other, and some topics aren't intuitive, it's easy to get lost once you misunderstand some concepts. Seek help IMMEDIATELY if you've doubts.
üí¢ In addition, shape multiplication and "hanging of BMD" are used extensively, DON'T underestimate these skills‚ÄºÔ∏è

‚Ñπ My thought on this course: Students doing well in 2110 can grasp the course content easier and faster than others as this course is more like a continuation of 2110, rather than 2120.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lambros' teaching style is similar to his performance in Statics, but there are sth worth noticing:
1. The teaching pace in 3310 is much faster than in 2110, ü§Ø STAY ALERT‚ÄºÔ∏è
2. There are many errors in his calculation, but he‚Äôll correct them after starting another things, ü§î, making students quite hard to focus.
3. His handwriting in the uploaded lecture notes is very small as in normal lecture in campus, there are also errors in calculation which he doesn't discover in lectures.üò£
4. Weaker students may have a hard time catching up and understanding what Lambros says.üò£

In my opinion, Lambros' teaching quality is impaired in online mode. He rushed through the later topics probably due to time constraint. However, you can always ask Lambros about some difficult assignments and request delay on due date. You can interrupt him in lectures too. He also held 2 tutorials during study break to do additional examples and answered students' questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
[IDK why some courses at UST distribute grades w/o revealing final scores even in online mode, not only this course. üò°]
‚ö†Ô∏è I may be biased in this part, the grading "C" for this course is compared with CIVL 2810, 3510 & 3730.

Grading Scheme:
10% HW and Quizzes
10% Lab report
30% Midterm (covering L1-L16)
50% Final (covering all topics)

Lambros said students' grades would improve if their final performance is better than their midterm, but nobody knows the exact details.

My Performance and Official Statistics:
Midterm: 91 [Mean: 49.4, SD: 23, Highest: 93]
Final: „äôÔ∏è, but I made some errors
Others: „äôÔ∏è, but I missed 1 poll

Final Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
[This greatly depends on your ability and previous knowledge.]

There're 5 HW and an individual lab report to finish this semester. The due date of the lab report is after the final period as someone's request (thx to himüòÄ) so it's alright for me. Lambros will upload his handwritten notes on Canvas during online mode (he never does this in normal mode), but you still need to attend every lecture as there may be Zoom polls which count as "Quizzes".

reviews.author: engineIsGood
reviews.comment_content:
Same as other review. However, he did not have time to teach moment distribution method (the last topic) in this semester. You may learn it yourself on YouTube or other platform if you wish.

There is one mid-term, one final, 5 HW and one lab report.

Lambros and TA will not tell you after they have released a hw. Please check Canvas from time to time.

There is a Lab session in mid-November, although there is not lab session in our timetable. Lambros would tell you to register a time that you are free to do the lab. The lab report will be done by a group of 5-6 people. If you can't find groupmates, seek help from TA as soon as possible.

The most important thing is to attend lecture. He may give you a short quiz to take attendance (not every lecture).
reviews.comment_teaching:
He teaches well. He explains concepts much better than other professors.

From other reviews, it seems that he did not have lecture notes and he wrote all the things on whiteboard before COVID-19 starts. However, in this semester, he write all the things on OneNote in computer and project to the screen. He also upload those hand-written lecture notes and lecture video to canvas.
reviews.comment_grading: Only the score of mid-term is released. I don't know the score of other components. Not really know whether the grading is good or not.
reviews.comment_workload: Initially, I would give it a B. However, the deadline of lab report is one day after the final exam (In this semester, the date of CIVL3310 final is the last day of exam period). I think normal people would not do the lab report during the study break since we need to study. Most people do it after the final exam. So, we have only 1.5 days to complete it. Therefore, I would give workload a C grade.

reviews.author: iamgoodguy
reviews.title: civl 3310
reviews.comment_content: The content are useful for internship program
reviews.comment_teaching: professor lambros is good in teaching. But, he teaches too fast,we will not have enough time to learn and practice all of the concept , i really want to cry. Also, notes are not organized with powerpoint.
reviews.comment_grading:
3-4 assignments
No statistic is given
My results are around average in midterm , and midterm have stats. I slightly above mean. But final i mess it up.
Independent Learning is the skill i learn from this course. Professor teaches too fast.
Midterm:70/100 mean:49/100
final:? mean:?
reviews.comment_workload: Quite reasonable but without some really practical exercise. Homework is way more easier than exam which makes me feel worried.

reviews.author: hhhhhhhhh
reviews.title: harsh grading
reviews.comment_content: dont repeat as its provided in prevous comments
reviews.comment_teaching: professor lambros is passionate in teaching. However, he teaches too fast, especially the content after midterm. You wont have enough time to learn and practice all of the concept unless you have a really good foundation in civl2110 and civl2120. Also, he only provides handwritten notes in the lecture and it's a bit difficult to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm slightly above mean.
assignment: no statistics
final: no statistics
lab: no statistics

Many of us did poorly in final(including me).Finally, i get c+ only. POOR GRADING FOR SURE.
they dont provide the above statistics except midterm because they said the statistics cannot be disclosed. RUBBISH.
reviews.comment_workload:
need SOOOO much time to prepare for the final as it contains TONS of new and DIFFICULT concept. However, spending much time on it absolutely does NOT mean u can manage the exam questions.
Even need to do the lab after final exam.

reviews.author: KeLe
reviews.title: Satisfactory
reviews.comment_content:
Influence line + indeterminate structure analysis
There are different methods for the analysis, you need to remember all for the exam.
If you interested in structural course like 2120,2110, then 3310 definitely suits you.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good instructor.
You could ask any question to him, he is really helpful and nice.
But don't talk and do anything not relate to course, he requires everyone to focus on the lecture.

Also, the TAs could help you a lot if you get any problem in the lecture material and report.

You need to watch lecture video before class, there is just 1.5 hour lecture a week and no tutorial session.
reviews.comment_grading:
Actually the grade is not that bad. The final exam is relatively easy for this year.
But be aware that the mean is really low and sd is really high. So there is great diversity of students.
Mean could have C.

Milestone quiz *3: 15%
Online quiz: 7%
In class participation: 8%
Lab report: 10%
Final exam: 60%
reviews.comment_workload:
Comparing to other civil courses in fall sem, the work load is relatively low.
The online quiz is just 2 mc a week, and totally 7 quizzes. (Not hard)
Only 1 lab report for a group, so if no free-rider, it should be good.
No assignment.

reviews.author: lmaoccc
reviews.title: CCChang we will miss u
reviews.comment_content: A civil student required course. Content is essentially important for structural engineering so if you want to develop your structural skills, you need to pay attention to this course. Prof CCChang adjusted the difficulty a bit harder as he always says he has a high expectation to his student. Content would be interesting if you like 2110 and 2120.
reviews.comment_teaching: I took it in spring sem so my prof is CCChang instead of Lambros. Prof CCChang's accent is great and could be easily understood. He is keen on answering questions in class. His class is not boring even we had online classes throughout the whole semester. He encourages students to participate more and ask questions in class. Anyway, CCChang is leaving UST so wish you all the best on new prof.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizzes are hard but final is fairly acceptable.
> 85/100 for A- or above
reviews.comment_workload:
1. Weekly discussions (10%)
2. 2 quizes (10%+10%)
3. final exam (40%)
4. 1 lab report (20%)
5. Weekly or bi-weekly assignment (10%)

Workload is acceptable if you don't hate this course.

reviews.author: Sivani
reviews.title: Useful and unique methods for analyzing structures
reviews.comment_content: All the content anticipated to solve determinate and indeterminate structures are covered. More emphasis is put on some parts than others based on difficulty.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. is very passionate and I particularly like that he makes up the problems himself and doesn't just copy them from the textbook. I like that provides shortcuts and tricks to approaching and solving problems quickly where necessary.
reviews.comment_grading: The midterm was very difficult. Prof. then said if students did well in the final that he would discount the midterm. Grades varied significantly.
reviews.comment_workload:
Considering the low weighting of the homework assignments, the workload was light. Those who wished to do well in the homework assignments may have found that the workload was heavier as some of the problems in the assignments were quite difficult.

Lab report is quite simple if everyone does their part.

reviews.author: Cayman
reviews.comment_content:
Basically, this course was divided into two parts, determinate structure analysis and indeterminate structure analysis.
Analysis of determinate structures: Centre of rotation, stability, influence line, finding the deflection by conjugate beam method and virtual work method.
Analysis of indeterminate structures: Force method, slope-deflection method and moment distribution method.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Lambros taguht the materials in details. He gave a lot of example in class. Moreover, the makeup-classes in the study break and before the final exam were very important. He gave a lot of tips and the outline of the exam paper.
reviews.comment_workload: There were 6 assignments in total throughout the semester and a lab report at the end of the course. The assignments were not complicated, but time consuming. The lab report was due after the final, so time should not be a problem.

reviews.author: xyz123
reviews.title: Good Teaching
reviews.comment_content: Structural forms and modeling, statically determinate structures, statically indeterminate structures, force and displacement methods, deflections of structures, influence lines, approximate analysis, energy methods.
reviews.comment_teaching: CCC is the coordinator of the common core. He used blended learning in this course. His teaching is clear and more concept-based. He is very nice and willing to answer your question.
reviews.comment_grading:
60% final
40% on lab, quiz and in class discussion
The result of quizzes and final exam really decides your grade
Final exam quite tricky about the concept, mean is around 30 marks.
The grading is two-tailed with many As and Fs.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much, easy quiz every week, lab report is fine if you have good teammates. No midterm.

reviews.author: igh88
reviews.comment_content: Influence lines, conjugate beam method, virtual work, force method, slope-deflection (displacement) method
reviews.comment_teaching: Explains concepts clearly and slowly (repeats difficult points many times), and uses a very original approach which can solve problems much faster than what most professors teach.
reviews.comment_workload: No lecture notes, so have to attend class and make your own notes. If you focus and work hard in class to make good notes, you shouldn't need too much work to understand the concepts. But, the homeworks are quite time-consuming. There is also a group lab report.

reviews.author: Marco_long
reviews.comment_content:
È†≠3ÂÄãÁ¶ÆÊãúÂü∫Êú¨‰∏äÂêå2110Â≠∏ÈÅéÊó¢str Èáé‰∏ÄÊ®£ÔºåmidtermÈÉΩ‰øÇÂ§ö‰Ωúinfluence line‰∏ÄÂÄãtopicÔºåÈõ£Â∫¶ÂîîÈ´ò„ÄÇ

reviews.author: Nelson Hung
reviews.title: wrost course ever
reviews.comment_content:
introduction to force equilibrium
static determinate and static indeterminate
stability
kinematic approach
moment of inertia
truss

basically you can watch coursera to learn all the things without attending his lesson
reviews.comment_teaching: He will occasionally pick students who are not concentrating in class. Added to the above, he will pretend to have quiz to prevent student leaving his lesson early.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is hard to tell because he did not release mean and sd to us.
Also, he did not release the paper therefore students that cannot check the paper.

Good grade for people that studied hard and ask questions during lesson
reviews.comment_workload:
Homework
Pop up quizzes
Midterm
3 hours Final

reviews.author: Isaac0925
reviews.comment_content: the content covers solving statically indetermainate sturcture with force method, displacement method and more. The displancement with spring support have to pay special attention as it appears in the final
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Lambros is passionate and always welcome different question, no matter it is "trivial" or "advance"
reviews.comment_grading: professor lambros is leninet with the grading, but there is something to note. You have to try to fail the course, just as you have to try to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is really light, the only thing to worry is to attend the lab in  time and do the report as it is due near the time of the fianl

reviews.author: jeff1111
reviews.comment_content: Just more advanced knowledge in the civil 2110 for the structural analysis such as determine the system is stable/ statically determine or not
reviews.comment_teaching: only handwritten notes are provided and no any addition notes or powerpoint. they dont even upload the handwritten notes of the prof during the lecture to canvas
reviews.comment_grading:
the midterm and the final are both very difficult
and the instructor decided to not publish our score in the mid-term and final as well as our hw so students were not able to fully understand the grading system and their own score. You have to email prof or TA for your actual score in the exam/mid-term.
attendance is a must
reviews.comment_workload:
one assignment every two weeks and have a quiz during the lesson
midterm and final as well

reviews.author: ljdjlalb
reviews.title: Review on 3310
reviews.comment_content:
Same as the above.

Is not as hard as other review said. One reason is the last topic "moment distribution method" is not covered and the exam paper difficulty is lower. Try to do HW, tutorial questions on your own self and study through the solutions. Your will at least get B range
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lambros is fun, passionate in teaching, but he always makes minor mistakes on calculation.

Give sufficient examples on each topics.

However, Contents are not organised. For the topic of influence line, there are situations that COR will have different location while the logic on finding COR are not concisely present which you have to conclude it going through examples in lecture and tutorial. Also, when to use adapted equation and not adapted equation in moment method are not clearly explained.

He teaches his approach on the contents i.e. Kinematic approach and adapted equation on moment method. Meaning you have to catch up every lecture.

General speaking, the teaching is above the average.
reviews.comment_grading: Should be following general uni grading scheme.
reviews.comment_workload:
Average

5 HW, mid-term, final and one lab report.

Try to do the stuff b4 deadlines, especially for lab report.

reviews.author: FKU_ISOM2310
reviews.comment_content:
Stability
Influence Line
Conjugate Beam Method
Energy Method
Force Method
Displacement Method
Moment Distribution Method

Dr. Lambros teaches a little bit less than Dr. CC Chang
reviews.comment_teaching:
Make sure you attend ALL lectures and sit at the front.
He writes everything on the whiteboard and you have to jot it all down as he will not upload any notes.
reviews.comment_grading:
To be honest, the grading is very harsh
He simply gives a lot of Cs and just a little of As
If you don't know some questions or even just finish a little in the final, you will simply get a C.

Midterm Exam: 30%
Final Exam: 50%
Assignment: 10%
Lab Report: 10%

MT:
Mean: 64.14
Std: 24.53
Max/Min:100/6

Other scores were not released.

Most of my friends got 90-100 in MT. I got 91/100 and got an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost the least workload within the fall semester.  There are 4-5 assignments and a lab report, and you can copy from sources.

The only workload is to attend lectures and make sure you DO SUBMIT ALL THE QUIZZES (Taking attendance only).

Before the final exam, he held an additional tutorial and he will outline the exam questions in class. So the final exam is not that difficult if you go to the tutorial.

reviews.author: NCTROLL
reviews.title: I LOVE LAMBROS
reviews.comment_content:
CIVL2110 and 2120 are very important to this course as the concepts will be used repeatedly again.

Course Content:
The content is the same as the other review so I won't repeat here. The content is quite interesting content (same as most of the civl course).
reviews.comment_teaching: Lambros is a good teacher as you will learn everything from his lecture (although numerous minor mistakes are made). However, his teaching may not be as effective as before in the online mode (the camera position is not that good...). Perhaps lambros did not get used to teach in online mode. Good luck.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab report: No statistic.
Midterm: Mean = 49.4, sd = 23
my score = 45
Final: Statistic is not released but I guess I have made a great improvement (midterm below mean still got B).
Final grade: B
reviews.comment_workload: In-class quizzes, 5 assignments and 1 lab report in total and some of them are quite difficult. If you do not understand some of the questions, you may ask lambros. A good thing about the online mode is that we don't need to answer the questions of lambros suddenly in the lecture. REMEMBER TO ATTEND THE CLASS AS THERE WILL BE QUIZ.
